trans-unit.source: The binding element that specifies the .NET Binary Format for XML used to encode messages.
Encoding is the process of transforming a message into a sequence of bytes.
Decoding is the reverse process.
[!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)] includes three types of encoding for SOAP messages: Text, Binary and Message Transmission Optimization Mechanism (MTOM).

The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BinaryMessageEncodingBindingElement> is the binding element that specified the .NET Binary Format for XML should be used for encoding messages, and has options to specify the character encoding and the SOAP and WS-Addressing version to be used.
Binary encoding is most efficient but least interoperable of the encoding options.

[!INCLUDE[crabout](~/includes/crabout-md.md)] the binding element that specifies messages are encoded using a textual representation of XML, see <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.TextMessageEncodingBindingElement>.

[!INCLUDE[crabout](~/includes/crabout-md.md)] the binding element that specifies messages are encoded using the MTOM message encoding, see <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MtomMessageEncodingBindingElement>.
To implement a custom message encoder, use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageEncodingBindingElement> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BinaryMessageEncodingBindingElement"></xref> class.
Builds the channel factory stack on the client that creates a specified type of channel for a specified context.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext"></xref> for the channel.
The type of channel the channel factory produces.
An of type TChannel for the specified context.
Builds the channel listener on the service that accepts a specified type of channel for a specified context.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext"></xref> for the listener.
The type of channel the channel listener accepts.
An of type TChannel for the specified context.
Returns a value that indicates whether the current binding can build a listener for a specified type of channel and context.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext"></xref> for the listener.
The type of channel the channel listener accepts.
`true` if the specified channel listener stack can be built on the service; otherwise, `false`.
Creates a new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BinaryMessageEncodingBindingElement"></xref> object initialized from the current one.
This creates a complete copy of the current binding element object tree, also called a deep clone.
A deep clone of an object creates a copy of the object and a copy of everything directly or indirectly referenced by that object.
(This can also be described as copying the entire object graph.) Returning a deep clone enables the runtime to support the case in which multiple custom bindings share a custom binding element.
If a deep clone is not returned, the runtime behavior is undefined.
A shallow clone of an object, by contrast, is a copy of the object only.
If the object contains references to other objects, the shallow copy does not create copies of the referred objects; instead, it copies only the references to the original objects.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BinaryMessageEncodingBindingElement"></xref> object with property values equal to those of the current element.
Gets or sets the compression format for the binding element.
The compression format for the binding element.
Creates a factory for binary message encoders that employ the SOAP and WS-Addressing versions and the character encoding specified by the current encoding binding element.
The<xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageEncoder> objects that the factory produces can read and write messages using the binary message encoding.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageEncoderFactory"></xref> that this binding element creates.
Returns a typed object requested, if present, from the appropriate layer in the binding element stack.
Use this to request a typed object for setting properties or getting status from the appropriate layer in the binding element stack.
If a layer supports returning the requested object, it returns it.
If not, it delegates the call down to the next layer in the stack.
If it gets to the bottom of the stack and no binding element layer supported the requested object, then the method returns `null`.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext"></xref> for the binding element.
The typed object for which the method is querying.
The typed object T requested if it is present or `null` if it is not.
Gets or sets the maximum number of XML readers that are allocated to a pool and are ready for use to process incoming messages.

Increasing this number increases memory consumption, but prepares the encoder to deal with sudden bursts of incoming messages because it is able to use readers from the pool are already created instead of having to create new ones.
The maximum number of readers to be kept in the pool.
The default value is 64 readers.
The value set is less than or equal to zero.
Gets or sets the maximum amount of memory available within a session for optimizing transmission procedures.
The .NET Binary Format for XML can optimize the transmission of strings when they are used in multiple messages within a session.
Once a string is sent in a message, additional messages that contain that string can refer to it using only the string's ID.
This requires that the strings and their IDs be stored in memory.
This allows the ID to be retransmitted in subsequent messages instead of the entire string.
This lookup increases the efficiency of message transmission when using the binary format.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BinaryMessageEncodingBindingElement.MaxSessionSize%2A> gets and sets the maximum amount of memory that is allocated to store these strings.
The maximum size, in bytes, of a session.
The default value is 2048 bytes.
The value is less than or equal to zero.
Gets or sets the maximum number of XML writers that are allocated to a pool and are ready for use to process outgoing messages.

Increasing this number increases memory consumption, but prepares the encoder to deal with sudden bursts of outgoing messages because it is able to use writers from the pool that are already created instead of having to create new ones.
The maximum number of writers to be kept in the pool.
The default value is 16 writers.
The value is less than or equal to zero.
Gets or sets the SOAP message and WS-Addressing versions that are used or expected.
Specifies the versions of SOAP and WS-Addressing associated with a message and its exchange.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion"></xref> that is used or expected.
The value set is `null`.
The value set is an unsupported envelope version.
Gets constraints on the complexity of XML messages that can be processed by endpoints configured with this binding element.
The complexity constraints protect against a class of denial of service (DOS) attacks that attempt to use message complexity to tie up endpoint processing resources.
The properties that express these constraints and their default values are as follows:
<xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas.MaxDepth%2A> = 32
<xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas.MaxStringContentLength%2A> = 8192
<xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas.MaxArrayLength%2A> = 16384
<xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas.MaxBytesPerRead%2A> = 4096
<xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas.MaxNameTableCharCount%2A> = 16384
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas"></xref> that specifies the complexity constraints on SOAP messages exchanged.
The default values for these constraints are provided in the following remarks section.
Returns whether the SOAP message structure version should be serialized.
The version of the SOAP message determines the structure of the message.
`true` if the SOAP message structure version should be serialized; otherwise, `false`.
Returns whether the values of constraints placed on the complexity of SOAP message structure should be serialized.
`true` if reader quotas should be serialized; otherwise, `false`.
Writes a custom binary message encoding elements into the generated metadata for an endpoint.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExporter"></xref> that exports the metadata information.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlContractConversionContext"></xref> object that provides mappings from exported WSDL elements to the contract description.
Writes a custom binary message encoding elements into the generated WSDL for a contract.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter"></xref> that exports the contract information.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlContractConversionContext"></xref> object that provides mappings from exported WSDL elements to the contract description.
Writes a custom binary message encoding elements into the generated WSDL for an endpoint.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter"></xref> that exports the contract information.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlEndpointConversionContext"></xref> object that provides mappings from exported WSDL elements to the endpoint description.
context is `null`.
